intro: Andinocleome limoneolens, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow or orange bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
